name: Buttermilk Strawberry Shortcake
author: Emmie4life
summary: A light biscuit topped with delicious strawberries.
ingredients: ¾ cup chilled unsalted butter, cut into small pieces
directions: Preheat the oven to 425 degrees F (220 degrees C)
Line a baking sheet with parchment paper
Whisk together flour, baking powder, baking soda, 1/3 cup white sugar, and salt in a mixing bowl
Cut in cold butter with a knife or pastry blender until the mixture resembles coarse crumbs
(If desired, place flour mixture into the work bowl of a food processor with the butter; pulse several times to cut butter into the flour mixture
Transfer mixture to a mixing bowl, and proceed
) Stir in buttermilk until the flour mixture is moistened
Drop 1/3-cup scoops of the dough 2 inches apart onto the prepared baking sheet
Brush biscuits with heavy cream and sprinkle generously with turbinado sugar
Bake in the preheated oven until golden brown, 15 to 20 minutes
Mix together the sliced strawberries, 1/4 cup white sugar, and lemon juice in a large bowl
Allow berries to rest until juices develop, about 30 minutes
Serve the strawberries with juice over the biscuits
